paragraphs.content: The Epistle of Paul to Titus
Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

paragraphs.content: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;
paragraphs.contentHtml: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

paragraphs.content: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
paragraphs.contentHtml: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

paragraphs.content: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

paragraphs.content: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

paragraphs.content: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

paragraphs.content: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

paragraphs.content: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;
paragraphs.contentHtml: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

paragraphs.content: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

paragraphs.content: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

paragraphs.content: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.

paragraphs.content: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

paragraphs.content: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;
paragraphs.contentHtml: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

paragraphs.content: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

paragraphs.content: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

paragraphs.content: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
